NAIDOC stands for National Aborigines and Islanders Day Observance Committee. Its origins can be traced to the emergence of Aboriginal groups in the 1920′s which sought to increase awareness in the wider community of the status and treatment of Indigenous Australians.

Predominately, NAIDOC Week is held in the first week (a Sunday to Sunday) of July that incorporates the second Friday - which historically was celebrated as 'National Aboriginal Day'. It is a time to celebrate Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander history, culture and achievements and is an opportunity to recognise the contributions that Indigenous Australians make to our country and society.

The 2019 NAIDOC in the Mall theme is ‘Voice. Treaty. Truth. Let’s work together’.

The free event will include speeches, live music and a range of interactive activities.

Join the City of Adelaide this Spring at Hurtle Square / Tangkaira for a chilled-out afternoon of music, markets, and mouthwatering delights at Acoustic Beats & Brews - a free community event that's all about good vibes.
Grab a picnic rug or find shade under an umbrella and let the smooth acoustic beats wash over you. Sip on delicious brews provided by the Original Coopers Alehouse, sample tasty bites from local food stalls such as the Paella Man and Opa Alfajores. And explore market treasures crafted by talented creatives from The Mill.
Whether you're there to kick back with friends or discover something new, this is your chance to soak up the rhythm of the city in a relaxed, welcoming space.
